H0.text: Producer is the classification that best describes a brown bear that eats a variety of foods, including berries, insects, and small animals.

H1.text: Herbivore is the best description of a brown bear that eats a variety of foods including berries, insects, and small animals.

H2.text: Carnivore is the best description of a brown bear that eats a variety of foods including berries, insects, and small animals.

H3.text: Omnivore is the best description of a brown bear that eats a variety of foods including berries, insects, and small animals.

A4.text: Contrary to popular belief, the brown bear derives 90% of its diet from plants.

A5.text: Despite their reputation, most brown bears are not highly carnivorous, as they derive up to 90% of their dietary food energy from vegetable matter.
